Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO UTILIZE THE RECENTLY ESTABLISHED CAREER CONNECT WASHINGTON (CCW) SECTOR HUBS TO CREATE SECTOR APPRENTICESHIP HUBS (SAHS) TO EXPAND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS IN SIX HIGH-DEMAND SECTORS: CLEAN ENERGY, HEALTHCARE, ADVANCED MANUFACTURING AND AEROSPACE, TECHNOLOGY AND CYBERSECURITY, MARITIME, AND CONSTRUCTION.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
1. BUILD SECTOR APPRENTICESHIP HUBS
A. INDUSTRY ENGAGEMENT AND SUPPORT
B. ENGAGING UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES
2. DEVELOP SECTOR STRATEGIES
A. DATA-INFORMED DECISION MAKING
B. POLICY AND SYSTEM ALIGNMENT
3. LAUNCH NEW AND EXPAND EXISTING RAPS IN HIGH DEMAND SECTORS
A. SECURE NEW EMPLOYER COMMITMENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN PROGRAMS WITHIN SECTOR STRATEGY INCLUDING EXPANDED CONDITIONAL HIRING COMMITMENTS AND SIGNED MEMORANDA OF UNDERSTANDING
B. IMPLEMENT COMPETITIVE PROCUREMENT PROCESS FOR PROGRAM INTERMEDIARIES
4. GRANT ADMINISTRATION
A. ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH U. S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR STANDARDS AND PROCEDURES INCLUDING SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS OF APPRENTICESHIP BUILDING AMERICA GRANT PROGRAM
B. DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT PROCUREMENT PROCESS TO QUALIFIED PROGRAM INTERMEDIARIES
C. TRACK PERFORMANCE OF PROJECT AND PROGRESS OF PROGRAM INTERMEDIARIES AND REPORT ON THESE ACTIVITIES

DELIVERABLES
300

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
N/A

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
AS GRANT RECIPIENT, ESD WILL LEAD PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND CONDUCT ADMINISTRATION AND OVERSIGHT OF FEDERAL FUNDS. ESD WILL ISSUE AN INTERAGENCY AGREEMENT TO THE WORKFORCE TRAINING & EDUCATION COORDINATING BOARD, THE STATE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BOARD, TO CONDUCT AN EVALUATION OF GRANT ACTIVITIES.

ESD WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE QUALIFIED PROGRAM INTERMEDIARIES. BIDDERS WILL SUBMIT PROPOSALS FOR CREATING NEW OR EXPANDING EXISTING RAPS AND PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS. THESE CONTRACTORS WILL LEAD AND EXECUTE ALL ASPECTS OF PROGRAM DESIGN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH IDENTIFIED EMPLOYER SPONSORS, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. EACH CONTRACTOR WILL SEEK APPROVAL OF NEW OR EXPANDED RAPS BY THE WASHINGTON STATE APPRENTICESHIP & TRAINING COUNCIL.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM TO DEVELOP A PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING ACADEMY (PTA) TRAINING GUIDE AND PTA PRE-APPRENTICESHIP AND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING DELIVERY, CONVENE A HEALTH CAREERS ALLIANCE (HCA) COLLABORATIVE OF MAJOR HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS IN MICHIGAN.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
DEVELOP A PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING ACADEMY (PTA) TRAINING GUIDE AND PTA PRE-APPRENTICESHIP AND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING DELIVERY, CONVENE A HEALTH CAREERS ALLIANCE (HCA) COLLABORATIVE OF MAJOR HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS IN MICHIGAN FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW PRE-APPRENTICESHIP AND APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS IN CRITICAL AND HIGH-DEMAND
HEALTHCARE OCCUPATIONS, UTILIZE ASSET MAPPING FOR THE MICHIGAN REVOLUTION FOR ELECTRIFICATION OF VEHICLES (MIREV) EMPLOYER-LED COLLABORATIVE (ELC) TO BUILD THE ELECTRIFIED VEHICLE AND MOBILITY TALENT PIPELINE, PROMOTE AND DELIVER INTERMEDIARY STANDARDS HOLDING FOR APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS THROUGH THE AMCAI TEAM OF APPRENTICESHIP EXPERTS, SCHEDULE AND DELIVER INFORMATIONAL SESSIONS TO EMPLOYERS AND PRESENTATIONS AT STATEWIDE AND REGIONAL CONFERENCES ON EEO/AAP RESOURCES, DEVELOP CAREER AWARENESS CAMPAIGN AND LITERATURE, EXPLORE, DEVELOP, AND COORDINATE ACTIVITIES TO HOST AND POST PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TO APPRENTICESHIP CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS, CONTRIBUTE TO THE MCCA'S EPIC CONSORTIUM TAXONOMY OF ALL-ACCESS COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMMING AS A STRATEGY OF RAPID RESPONSE TO EMPLOYER NEED, DEVELOP A YOUTH APPRENTICESHIP MODEL, CREATE ACCELERATED CAREER PATHWAYS BY COLLABORATING WITH EMPLOYERS FOR ENTRY-LEVEL JOB TRAINING TO BUILD USDOL APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS (RAPS) AND BUILD EMPLOYER-LED COLLABORATIVES, SUCH AS MIREV AND HCA, FOLLOWING THE PRINCIPLES OF THE U.S. CHAMBER OF COMMERCE FOUNDATION TALENT PIPELINE MANAGEMENT METHODOLOGY.

DELIVERABLES
550

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
ALL POPULATIONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON UNEMPLOYED, UNDEREMPLOYED, WOMEN, MINORITIES, VETERANS, AND DISABLED.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
OUTPUTS INCLUDE DELIVERY OF 350 PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS LEADING TO A MINIMUM OF 200 REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIPS DELIVERED IN NON-TRADITIONAL AND TRADITIONAL SECTORS; A PROVISION OF $500,000 FOR TRAINING, TUITION REIMBURSEMENT, AND JOURNEYPERSON STIPEND FUNDING; PROVIDING EEO/AAP POLICIES TO SMALL AND MIDSIZE ENTERPRISE TO SUPPORT LABOR FORCE DIVERSIFICATION; ENGAGE AND MEET WITH EMPLOYERS AND DEVELOP NEW AMCAI TOOLS AND STRATEGIES. PARTNERS WILL COLLABORATE WITH SPONSORS TO CO-DESIGN PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS IN SPECIFIC INDUSTRY SECTORS. PROGRAMING WILL INCLUDE BASIC TECHNICAL AND SOFT SKILLS THAT WILL PREPARE PARTICIPANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT AS REGISTERED APPRENTICES.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO FORM A MULTI-PARTNER REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP HUB THAT WILL SERVE AS A NETWORK OF REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM (RAP) SPONSORS AND INTERMEDIARIES IN ORDER TO EXPAND APPRENTICESHIP IN CA IN THE FOLLOWING INDUSTRIES AND CONNECT JOB SEEKERS TO EMPLOYERS AND WELL-PAID CAREERS IN QUALITY JOBS: 1) MANUFACTURING; 2) HEALTHCARE; 3) IT/CYBERSECURITY; 4) ARTS, MEDIA & ENTERTAINMENT; AND 5) CLEAN ENERGY/ TRANSPORTATION.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
1.	SERVE AS REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP INTERMEDIARIES TO DEVELOP AND LAUNCH RAPS.
2.	PROVIDE INCENTIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT RAP EMPLOYERS.
3.	CONNECT WITH NATIONAL, REGIONAL, STATE, AND/OR LOCAL EMPLOYERS AND INDUSTRY GROUPS TO EXPAND APPRENTICESHIP.
4.	DEVELOP A BOARD NETWORK OF PARTNERS TO SUPPORT RAP DEVELOPMENT AND SCALING.
5.	DEVELOP TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RESOURCES TO LAUNCH RAPS IN CRITICAL INDUSTRIES.
6.	ENCOURAGE EMPLOYERS TO UTILIZE PRE-APPRENTICESHIP DIRECTLY LEADING TO A RAP.
7.	COORDINATE AND LEVERAGE EFFORTS ACROSS ABA REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP HUBS TO HELP EXPAND AND SCALE RAPS AS PART OF A HUB NETWORK.
8.	INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING CROSS-CUTTING PRINCIPLES INTO ALL ACTIVITIES: 1) EQUITY, 2) JOB QUALITY, 3) SUPPORT FOR HIGH-QUALITY, SUSTAINABLE PROGRAMS, 4) EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACHES, AND 5) NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR INNOVATION, ENGAGEMENT, AND EASE OF ACCESS.
9.	ENGAGE INDUSTRY AND ORGANIZE STAKEHOLDER PARTNERS TO RECRUIT ADDITIONAL EMPLOYERS IN NEED OF INNOVATIVE METHODS TO DEVELOP THE TALENTED WORKFORCE NEEDED TO SUCCEED.
10.	ENGAGE A WIDE RANGE OF PARTNERS TO HELP UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ACCESS PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS.
11.	ARRANGE TRAINING AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR PARTICIPANTS AND ENSURE PROPER DATA COLLECTION OF PARTICIPANT GROWTH AND SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THEIR APPRENTICESHIP.


DELIVERABLES
800

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
N/A

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
APPRENTICESHIP DEVELOPMENT AND REGISTRATION; APPRENTICESHIP RECRUITMENT, ENROLLMENT AND MANAGEMENT.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM WILL INCREASE REGIONAL APPRENTICESHIP CAPACITY EXPAND APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, INVEST IN LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OF CRITICAL APPRENTICESHIP MANAGEMENT AND PERSONNEL, DIVERSIFY EMPLOYERS AND INDUSTRIES THAT USE THE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM IN THE INLAND EMPIRE, SERVE POPULATIONS THAT HISTORICALLY ARE UNDERREPRESENTED IN THE APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM, AND WORK TO INTEGRATE APPRENTICESHIP AS A PREMIER FEATURE OF OUR REGION'S HIGHER EDUCATION SYSTEM.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
LAUNCH WILL FORM A MULTI-PARTNER NETWORK CAPABLE OF SERVING AS A REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM (RAP) SPONSOR AND AS AN INTERMEDIARY CONNECTOR OF REGIONAL PROGRAM SPONSORS WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF SUPPORTING INDUSTRY'S NEEDS FOR CREATING AND EXPANDING RAPS IN NEW AND EMERGING SECTORS AND OCCUPATIONS. THROUGH THIS GRANT, LAUNCH WILL INCREASE THE REGIONAL INVESTMENTS IN THE FOLLOWING KEY APPRENTICESHIP STRATEGIES:
• EXPAND APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS
• DEVELOP AND EXPAND PUBLIC SECTOR APPRENTICESHIP OPPORTUNITIES
• SUPPORT THE LARGE-SCALE EXPANSION OF YOUTH PATHWAYS INTO APPRENTICESHIP

DELIVERABLES
1000

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE THE RESIDENTS OF RIVERSIDE AND SAN BERNARDINO, KNOWN AS THE INLAND EMPIRE (IE) AND HOME TO APPROXIMATELY 4.6 MILLION RESIDENTS. THIS IS A MINORITY-MAJORITY REGION, AS IN 2020, 51% OF THE POPULATION WAS HISPANIC; 31% WERE WHITE; 7% WERE BLACK; 7% WERE ASIAN; AND 2% WERE TWO OR MORE RACES. OF THE ENTIRE POPULATION, 13.7% LIVED IN POVERTY, AND MANY RESIDENTS ARE CONSIDERED "WORKING POOR." THE IE HAS LOW EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT OVERALL, AS THE 2020 CENSUS INDICATED THAT 18.2% DIDN'T GRADUATE FROM HIGH SCHOOL, AND ONLY 22.4% HAD OBTAINED A BACCALAUREATE DEGREE OR HIGHER. MORE THAN 42% OF PEOPLE SPOKE A LANGUAGE OTHER THAN ENGLISH AT HOME, WITH THE LARGEST GROUP SPEAKING SPANISH (34%). THE PROGRAM IS OPEN TO ALL BUT EFFORTS WILL TARGET UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS THAT HAVE STRUGGLED THE MOST DURING COVID AND/OR HAVE BEEN TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN APPRENTICESHIP.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO ENSURE A COLLECTIVE, COLLABORATIVE APPROACH TO APPRENTICESHIP OPPORTUNITIES THAT LEAD TO FAMILY-SUSTAINING WAGES, STABLE EMPLOYMENT, CAREER GROWTH, BENEFITS, AND PRIORITIZE DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ACCESSIBILITY TO AREA RESIDENTS.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PHILAWORKS HAS IDENTIFIED THE FOLLOWING AREAS AS THE MAIN FOCAL POINTS TO BE DIRECTLY ADDRESSED WITH FUNDING FROM THE AMERICA BUILDING APPRENTICESHIP GRANT:
•DECREASING THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE FOR YOUTH, BLACK AND BROWN PEOPLE, AND WOMEN
•LEVERAGING PARTNERSHIPS FROM ACROSS THE SEPA REGION TO BUILD CAPACITY AND SYSTEMS CHANGE FOR APPRENTICESHIPS
•FOCUSING ON BUILDING RAPS AND RPAPS
•ENSURING THE REGIONAL APPRENTICESHIP HUB COLLECTIVELY IDENTIFIES AND IMPLEMENTS KEY STRATEGIES IN CAREER PATHWAYS THAT LEAD TO FAMILY-SUSTAINING WAGES AND PRIORITIZE DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ACCESSIBILITY FOR ALL PEOPLE
•STRATEGICALLY DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STAFFING POSITIONS TO BUILD A COHESIVE, STREAMLINED PATHWAY FOR POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS AND APPRENTICES TO ACCESS

DELIVERABLES
400

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
YOUTH AND ADULT RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA REGION WITH A FOCUS ON BLACK AND BROWN RESIDENTS AND WOMEN.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
PHILAWORKS HAS IDENTIFIED THE FOLLOWING AREAS AS THE MAIN FOCAL POINTS TO BE DIRECTLY ADDRESSED WITH FUNDING FROM THE AMERICA BUILDING APPRENTICESHIP GRANT:
•DECREASING THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE FOR YOUTH, BLACK AND BROWN PEOPLE, AND WOMEN
•LEVERAGING PARTNERSHIPS FROM ACROSS THE SEPA REGION TO BUILD CAPACITY AND SYSTEMS CHANGE FOR APPRENTICESHIPS
•FOCUSING ON BUILDING RAPS AND RPAPS
•ENSURING THE REGIONAL APPRENTICESHIP HUB COLLECTIVELY IDENTIFIES AND IMPLEMENTS KEY STRATEGIES IN CAREER PATHWAYS THAT LEAD TO FAMILY-SUSTAINING WAGES AND PRIORITIZE DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ACCESSIBILITY FOR ALL PEOPLE
•STRATEGICALLY DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STAFFING POSITIONS TO BUILD A COHESIVE, STREAMLINED PATHWAY FOR POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS AND APPRENTICES TO ACCESS. 
SUBRECIPIENTS WILL WORK COLLECTIVELY WITH APHL AND PHILAWORKS TO ACHIEVE THESE ACTIVITIES DURING THE GRANT PERIOD.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS FOR LOCAL WORKFORCE INVESTMENT AREAS (LWIAS), INDUSTRY AND EMPLOYER GROUPS, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT THE CREATION AND EXPANSION OF REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS (RAPS) IN NON-TRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS AND INDUSTRIES, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON EDUCATION, HEALTHCARE, AND BIOSCIENCE/BIOTECHNOLOGY R&D AND MANUFACTURING.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
LAUNCHING AND EXPANDING RAP OPPORTUNITIES, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS THAT LEAD TO RAP ENROLLMENT; CONVENING SECTOR PARTNERSHIPS FOR INDUSTRY ENGAGEMENT AND SUPPORT; DEVELOPING UNIVERSAL PROMOTION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO COMMUNICATE THE VALUE OF RAP OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPLOYERS AND PARTNERSHIPS; ENGAGING IN PARTNERSHIP-BUILDING STRATEGIES FOR RAP SCAFFOLDING AND EXPANSION; EMPHASIZING ACCESS FOR UNDERREPRESENTED AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS VIA PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; LEVERAGING PUBLIC AND PRIVATE RESOURCES FOR BLENDED/BRAIDED FUNDING OF TRAINING COSTS AND WRAPAROUND SERVICES; UTILIZING A DATA-INFORMED DECISION-MAKING MODEL FOR CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICE DELIVERY; ENSURING POLICY AND SYSTEM ALIGNMENT ACROSS THE BISTATE REGION TO ENSURE SEAMLESS ENROLLMENT IN RAPS FOR EMPLOYERS AND PARTICIPANTS.

DELIVERABLES
850

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, INCLUDING DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES; YOUTH, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON YOUTH FROM UNDERSERVED REGIONS; RURAL RESIDENTS; AGING CANDIDATES WHO ARE HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY APPRENTICESHIP OPPORTUNITIES; WOMEN IN TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED RAPS; RETURNING CITIZENS FROM INCARCERATION; INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS; CANDIDATES IN INDUSTRIES SEVERELY IMPACTED BY COVID.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
HIRING OF MISSOURI RAP NAVIGATOR; HIRING OF EMPLOYER AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS MANAGER; RECRUITMENT OF DIVERSE RAP PARTICIPANTS; DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND EXPANDED RAPS WITH EMPLOYER SPONSORS; PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS FOR EQUITABLE RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF PARTICIPANTS FROM UNDERSERVED AND UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES; PARTICIPATION IN TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THE RAP HUBS IS TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF INDUSTRY IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION OF RAPS ACROSS A SPECTRUM OF SECTORS AND OCCUPATIONS, INCLUDING THE STATE-IDENTIFIED IN-DEMAND INDUSTRIES: HEALTHCARE, TECHNOLOGY, MANUFACTURING, CONSTRUCTION, HOSPITALITY, TRANSPORTATION/LOGISTICS, AND EDUCATION/CHILDCARE.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
(A) PROVIDE INCENTIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT RAP EMPLOYERS
(B) CONNECT WITH LOCAL, REGIONAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL EMPLOYERS
(C) STRENGTHEN A NETWORK FOR PARTNERS TO DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT, AND SCALE RAPS
(D) DEVELOP TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RESOURCES FOR RAPS STATEWIDE (FACILITATED BY HUBS)
(E) CONDUCT BUSINESS ENGAGEMENT OUTREACH TO PROMOTE THE VALUE OF APPRENTICESHIP AND PRE- APPRENTICESHIP TO EMPLOYERS
(F) COORDINATE AND LEVERAGE EFFORTS WITH OTHER RAP HUBS
(G) PROMOTE GREATER INCLUSION DIVERSITY, AND ACCESS IN APPRENTICESHIP
(I) BUILD CAPACITY OF THE STATE TO BETTER PROMOTE AND MANAGE APPRENTICESHIP
(J) PARTNER WITH EXISTING ORGANIZATION APPRENTICESHIP SPONSOR PROGRAMS TO INCLUDE UNDERSERVED AREAS OF THE STATE THROUGH OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT

DELIVERABLES
700

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNDERSERVED AND OR MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING: RACIAL MINORITIES, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, IMMIGRANTS, REFUGEES, RE-ENTRY POPULATIONS, VETERANS, AS WELL AS EMPLOYEES IN NON-TRADITIONAL ROLES AND THOSE THAT LIVE IN RURAL LOCATIONS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
CONSORTIUM MODEL SPONSORS, TECHNICAL RESOURCE PROVISIONS, PROMOTION OF INCLUSION, DIVERSITY, & ACCESS IN APPRENTICESHIPS; INTERMEDIARIES FOR DEVELOPMENT OF PRE-APPRENTICESHIP & RAPS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CREATE APPRENTICESHIP HUBS FOR THE TELECOMMUNICATIONS INDUSTRY THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
1. BUILD THREE NEW LABOR-MANAGEMENT APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, LOCATED IN THE BAY AREA AND THE NORTHERN, CENTRAL, SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE STATE. IN ORDER TO SUCCESSFULLY STRUCTURE THESE PROGRAMS, WE NEED TO RECRUIT FIBER INSTALLATION COMPANIES. ONE OF THE WAYS WE INTEND TO DO THIS IS TO ESTABLISH EMPLOYER BOOT CAMPS. 2. EXPAND THE NUMBER OF DIVERSE APPLICANTS ENTERING OUR PROGRAMS BY MEETING A GOAL OF AT LEAST 20 PERCENT YOUNG PEOPLE, PEOPLE OF COLOR, WOMEN AND VETERANS IN EACH OF THE APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS OVER THE FOUR-YEAR PERIOD. 3. BUILD AN EDUCATIONAL LADDER SO THAT OUR APPRENTICES WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION THROUGH AN ASSOCIATE'S DEGREE. 4. BUILD EMPLOYER ENGAGEMENT IN APPRENTICESHIP BY PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND FINANCIAL INCENTIVES THAT WOULD ASSIST THEM IN ADOPTING APPRENTICESHIP FOR THEIR COMPANIES AND ENABLE THEM TO BID ON JOBS WITH STRINGENT TECHNICAL AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS.

DELIVERABLES
156

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
WORKERS AND POTENTIAL WORKERS IN THE TELECOMMUNICATIONS INDUSTRY.

N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS ENTERING THE ELECTRICAL TRADES, INCREASING PATHWAYS FOR VETERANS, MONOLINGUAL SPANISH SPEAKERS, AND WOMEN OF COLOR TO ENTER INTO RAPS THROUGH PRE-APPS, AND TO DIVERSIFY THE ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN THE ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY; EDUCATING THEM ABOUT CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY; ENROLLING INDIVIDUALS FROM DIVERSE POPULATIONS INTO PRE-APPS; EXPANDING VEEPS BY ADDING TWO NEW LOCATIONS TO SERVE MORE VETERANS; DEVELOPING AN ENGLISH-SPANISH PRE-APP TO SUPPORT ESL INDIVIDUALS; DEVELOPING ESL CURRICULUM TAILORED TOWARDS LANGUAGE COMMONLY USED IN THE ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY; DEVELOPING MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS FOR WOMEN AND PEOPLE OF COLOR; DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING DEIB EDUCATION MODULES IN PRE-APP AND RAP CURRICULA; PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE WRAPAROUND SERVICES TO PRE-APPRENTICES.

CASSANDRA BANKS FOUNDATION WILL DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN WOMEN OF COLOR IN THE ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY. AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CONNECT PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES WITH PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING AND RAPS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: RCIL (ABOVE) WILL BE THE LEAD AGENCY TO BRING LOCALIZED AGENCIES SERVING PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES INTO THE PROJECT TO FOSTER OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT IN A RURAL AREA.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
CREATE, OPERATE AND THEN SUSTAIN REGIONAL PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS IN 5 SECTORS THAT CAN OFFER EMPLOYMENT (MANUFACTURING, IT, HEALTH CARE, SOCIAL ASSISTANCE, FINANCE, AS EXAMPLES) THROUGH APPRENTICESHIPS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ENTER AT A VARIETY OF LEVELS, AND HAVE BASIC SKILLS ADDRESSED BEFORE ENTERING A PROGRAM TO PROVIDE SECTOR-SPECIFIC SKILLS IN PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS THAT BLEND CLASSROOM AND HANDS-ON SKILLS. THE PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING CAN LEAD TO SHORT-TERM POSTSECONDARY TRAINING IF ESSENTIAL TO CONNECT WITH EMPLOYMENT. PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS WILL BE DESIGNED TO BE LESS THAN 180 DAYS IN LENGTH.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO ENROLL NEW PARTICIPANTS (HIGH SCHOOL AND OPPORTUNITY YOUTH) INTO APPROVED REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS AND EXPAND NEW PRE-APPRENTICESHIPS THAT WILL LEAD TO INTO NEW RAPS.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTNERING WITH THREE (3) EMPLOYER SPONSORS, FIVE (5) SCHOOL DISTRICTS, THE KENTUCKY EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT CABINET, FOUR (4) AREA DEVELOPMENT DISTRICTS AND A STATE-WIDE LABOR UNION TO MEET ALL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR OUR CATEGORY TWO (2) PROPOSAL. THE LOCAL\REGIONAL GEOGRAPHIC SCOPE OF THE PROJECT WILL BE CARRIED OUT IN THE COUNTIES OF GARRARD, JOHNSON, PULASKI, RUSSELL AND WOLFE COUNTIES IN KENTUCKY. THE OVERALL SCOPE OF NAVIGATE IS TO ESTABLISH AND INCREASE PARTNERSHIPS THAT COMMIT TO EXPANDING PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS WHICH WILL LEAD TO DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM (RAP) ENROLLMENT FOR OUR "HARD TO SERVE" HIGH SCHOOL & OPPORTUNITY YOUTH.

UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES/UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS / HIGH SCHOOL AND OPPORTUNITY YOUTH.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO EXPAND, DIVERSIFY, AND STRENGTHEN PRE-APPRENTICESHIPS AND THE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
"EV HUB PROGRAM WILL BRING TOGETHER LARGE-SCALE EMPLOYERS, COMMUNITY COLLEGES, AND REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORKFORCE PARTNERS TO CREATE A SCALABLE MODEL FOR TRAINING AND CREDENTIALING ELECTRIC VEHICLE-RELATED OCCUPATIONS. AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING IN HEALTHCARE (PATH) TO FILL A VITAL NEED IN PREPARING AND TRAINING INDIVIDUALS TO BE READY FOR RAPS AND EMPLOYMENT LEADING TO INCREASED DIVERSITY AND EQUITY IN HEALTHCARE THROUGHOUT THE SIX REGIONS WITHIN THE STATE OF ALASKA.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
BUILD TALENT PIPELINES LEADING TO RAPS BY DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A PLAN FOR EXPANDING PATH ACADEMIES; SUPPORTING EFFORTS TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF RAP HEALTHCARE OCCUPATIONS IN ALASKA; BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH EDUCATORS AND EMPLOYERS THAT PROMOTE APPRENTICESHIP; AND BUILDING A PIPELINE TO RAP THROUGH PATH ACADEMIES.


DELIVERABLES
560 STUDENTS WILL ENROLL IN AND COMPLETE PATH ACADEMIES WITHIN THE FOUR YEARS PROJECT PERIOD AND BE WELL POSITIONED AND PREPARED TO ENTER THE HEALTHCARE FIELD AS AN APPRENTICE, EMPLOYEE, OR COLLEGE STUDENT. A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN APCA AND ALASKA PACIFIC UNIVERSITY (APU) PROVIDES THOSE WHO COMPLETE ONE OF APCA'S HEALTHCARE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIPS WITH UNDERGRADUATE CERTIFICATE FROM APU, COMPRISED OF 24-41 CREDITS THAT CAN BE APPLIED TO OBTAINING TWO-OR FOUR-YEAR DEGREES IN HEALTH SCIENCES.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
ALASKA NATIVES, INDIGENOUS AMERICANS, ASIAN AMERICANS, PACIFIC ISLANDERS, BLACK AND LATINO, WOMEN, VETERANS, LOW-INCOME, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, AND LGBTQ+.

HOWEVER, TEACHER SHORTAGES ARE AT CRITICALLY HIGH LEVELS IN NORTH DAKOTA. DESPITE THESE TEACHER SHORTAGES, NDDPI IS OPTIMISTIC, BECAUSE WE BELIEVE THAT APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS OFFER AN ACCESSIBLE PATHWAY FOR MORE ASPIRING EDUCATORS TO ENTER THE PROFESSION. NORTH DAKOTA HAS OVER 4,000 PARAPROFESSIONALS, MANY OF WHOM HAVE A PASSION FOR SERVING SPECIAL EDUCATION POPULATIONS, AND MANY OF WHOM ASPIRE TO BECOME CERTIFIED TEACHERS. HOWEVER, SIMPLY DUE TO FINANCIAL BARRIERS OR INFLEXIBLE COURSE DELIVERY SCHEDULES FROM UNIVERSITIES, THEY ARE UNABLE TO DO SO. WE AIM TO USE THESE GRANT FUNDS TO ELIMINATE THOSE BARRIERS.  2.88M OF THE REQUESTED  3.6M WILL BE AWARDED ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS TO NORTH DAKOTA EDUCATION PREPARATION PROVIDERS (EPPS), WHO WILL SERVE AS RELATED INSTRUCTION PROVIDERS. FOR THE 3-YEAR PERIOD, NDDPI WILL RUN AN ANNUAL REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL, OFFERING 7 TO 13 GRANTS OF  100,000 EACH YEAR, TO WHICH EPPS ACROSS THE STATE CAN RESPOND IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS. IN THEIR RESPONSES, EPPS MUST DESCRIBE THEIR INNOVATIVE, HIGH-QUALITY PROGRAM MODELS  WHICH MUST ALIGN TO ALL REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP IN TEACHING REQUIREMENTS  AND STATE HOW MANY CANDIDATES THEY CAN PROVIDE WITH A DEGREE AND LICENSURE WITHIN A  100,000 BUDGET. NDDPI PROJECTS THAT THIS COMPETITIVE PROCESS WILL YIELD DRAMATIC COST SAVINGS ON TYPICAL UNIVERSITY RATES, WHILE FOSTERING MEANINGFUL COLLABORATION BETWEEN UNIVERSITIES AND SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND BUILDING LOCAL CAPACITY TO DESIGN AND OPERATE HIGH-QUALITY TEACHER APPRENTICESHIP MODELS. AT THE END OF YEAR 3, NDDPI AIMS FOR SAEF COMPETITIVE FUNDS TO HAVE CREATED 6 NEW RAPS AND EXPANDED 6 EXISTING RAPS, ENROLLING MORE THAN 157 APPRENTICES. MDES MISSION STATEMENT:HELPING MISSISSIPPIANS GET JOBS.OVERVIEW OF THE 5-YEAR WORK PLANSINCE 2016, THE MISSISSIPPI APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM (MAP) HAS BEEN A RECIPIENT OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABORS (USDOL) APPRENTICESHIP USA GRANT FUNDS TO CREATE, PROMOTE, AND EXPAND CAPACITY FOR REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS IN MISSISSIPPI. USDOL HAS INVESTED OVER  960 MILLION IN APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMS THROUGH GRANTS AND CONTRACTS NATIONWIDE AND NEARLY  7 MILLION HAS BEEN AWARDED TO MAP. THROUGH THESE GRANT FUNDS, MAP HAS BEEN ABLE TO ASSIST IN SUPPORTING TO DATE MORE THAN 5,000 APPRENTICES AND OVER 40 MISSISSIPPI COMPANIES IN REGISTERING APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS. SINCE 2016, THE MAP PROGRAM HAS TRANSITIONED PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES FROM THE MISSISSIPPI COMMUNITY COLLEGE BOARD (MCCB) TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF EMPLOYMENT SECURITY (MDES) WHERE A NEWLY CREATED MDES OFFICE OF APPRENTICESHIP WAS ESTABLISHED TO MEET THE GOALS OF THE GRANTS AND SUPPORT EXPANSION AND CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS IN MISSISSIPPI. SINCE THE TRANSITION OF THE PROGRAMMATIC FUNCTIONS OF MAP TO THE MDES OFFICE OF APPRENTICESHIP, WHERE THE FISCAL FUNCTIONS WERE ALWAYS HELD, THERE HAVE BEEN SOME SUCCESSES THAT HAVE CREATED OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE PROGRAM AND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP EFFORTS TO GROW. PIPELINES HAVE BEEN CREATED ACROSS VARIOUS INDUSTRY SECTORS TO BETTER SERVE UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES IN MISSISSIPPI. APPRENTICESHIP SUCCESSES AND POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDE INTEGRATION OF APPRENTICESHIP INTO OTHER STATE WORKFORCE EFFORTS. THIS INCLUDES LOCAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BOARDS (LWDBS) AND OTHER PARTS OF THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM THAT HAVE NOT BEEN ACTIVE IN THE APPRENTICESHIP SPACE, IN PART BECAUSE OF PERCEIVED COMPETITION OR DIFFERING GOALS. HOWEVER, MDES OFFICE OF APPRENTICESHIP INTENDS TO WORK TO REACH NEW AND EMERGING INDUSTRIES AND OCCUPATIONAL SECTORS AND BUILD BUY-IN BY WORKING WITH AND THROUGH THE LWDBS TO PROMOTE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP IN MISSISSIPPI. MDES CAN SUPPORT CONNECTING MDES OFFICE OF APPRENTICESHIP TO A MORE COHESIVE WORKFORCE ECOSYSTEM, BUILDING OUT CONNECTIONS TO THE LWDBS, THE ENTIRE MDES AGENCY BUSINESS ENGAGEMENT STAFF, AND OTHER MISSISSIPPI AGENCY PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS THAT COULD INCLUDE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF REHABILITATION SERVICES (MDRS), MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (MDHS), AND MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS (MDOC). ONE OF THE MOST RECENT SUCCESSES INCLUDES WORKING DIRECTLY WITH THE WORKFORCE AGENCY ACCELERATE MISSISSIPPI (AMS) TO BRAID FUNDING FOR A NEWLY REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM IN SHIPBUILDING.

TOTAL NUMBER OF APPRENTICES ENROLLED IN RAPS DURING THE LIFE OF THE GRANT:THERE WILL NOT BE GRANT SUPPORTED TRAINING PARTICIPANTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE BASE FORMULA FUNDING PROJECT.THE ARKANSAS SAEF BASE FORMULA FUNDING PROJECT IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE STATES CAPACITY TO SUPPORT REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP EXPANSION ACTIVITIES ACROSS INDUSTRY SECTORS WITH A FOCUS ON MANUFACTURING AND EDUCATIONAL SERVICES. ARKANSAS SAEF WILL BUILD ON SAE 2020 GRANT SUCCESSES ALIGNING WITH OVERARCHING GOALS LEADING TO:1)NATIONAL APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM BUILDING2)SYSTEM ALIGNMENT FOR APPRENTICESHIP EXPANSION3)IMPROVING DATA SHARING AND DATA INTEGRITYPOPULATIONS TO BE SERVED: ARKANSAS SAEF COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP IS INCLUSIVE OF THE WIOA SYSTEM, EDUCATION PARTNERS, RAP INTERMEDIARIES, AND RELATED WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES TO EXPAND PRE-APPRENTICESHIP AND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR JOB SEEKERS AND CAREER CHANGERS THAT INCLUDE UNDEREMPLOYED, UNEMPLOYED, DISLOCATED WORKERS, HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, AND OTHERS.TARGETED INDUSTRY(IES) AND OR OCCUPATION(S):  TARGETED INDUSTRIES INCLUDE MANUFACTURING AND EDUCATIONAL SERVICES. IN THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR, GROWTH OCCUPATIONS INCLUDE INDUSTRIAL MAINTENANCE, MACHINIST (I.E., CNC, PLC, TOOL AND DIE, ROBOTICS), QUALITY CONTROL TECHNICIANS, PRODUCTION TECHNICIANS, IT RELATED OCCUPATIONS, ETC. IN THE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES SECTOR, THE K-12 TEACHER RAP WILL BE IMPLEMENTED WORKING WITH ADE AND PARTNERING EDUCATIONAL SERVICES COOPERATIVES.SUMMARY OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES: BROADLY DEFINED, MIDDLE SKILL JOBS ARE THOSE THAT REQUIRE MORE THAN A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA BUT LESS THAN A BACHELORS DEGREE. THESE MIDDLE SKILL JOBS REPRESENT A SIGNIFICANT PERCENTAGE OF IN-DEMAND JOBS IN THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR. THE APPRENTICESHIP MODEL IS A VIABLE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND CAREER PATHWAY SOLUTION, WHETHER CONNECTING WITH YOUNG ADULTS AND OR POPULATIONS WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT THROUGH CERTIFIED PRE-APPRENTICESHIP OPPORTUNITIES (ALIGNED WITH RA) FOR WORK-READY SKILL ATTAINMENT OR DIRECTLY INTO A REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM. THE ARKANSAS SAEF PROJECT WILL SCALE THE ADOPTION OF THE RAP MODEL UTILIZING A PROVEN RAP SPONSOR INDUSTRY INTERMEDIARY STRATEGY TO MINIMIZE ADMINISTRATIVE BARRIERS FOR MANUFACTURING EMPLOYERS TO COMMIT. THE WIOA SYSTEM WILL BE LEVERAGED TO ENGAGE EMPLOYERS AND INTEGRATE STATE CERTIFIED PRE-APPRENTICESHIP AND REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AS AN OPTION TO MEET EMPLOYER NEEDS.THE ARKANSAS SAEF PROJECT WILL ALSO BE USED TO DEVELOP CERTIFIED PRE-APPRENTICESHIP ALIGNMENT WITH CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION SECONDARY CAREER CENTERS AS WELL AS LEVERAGE THE ARKANSAS STATE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE BE-PRO-BE-PROUD INITIATIVE TO EDUCATE YOUNG ADULTS FOR CAREER OPPORTUNITIES. THE ARKANSAS SAEF PROJECT WILL LOOK FOR OPPORTUNITIES TO PARTNER WITH AEDCS FUTURE FIT INITIATIVE TO INTEGRATE WORK-READY PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING TO ALIGN TO RA PATHWAYS IN THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR.IN THE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES SECTOR, THE ARKANSAS SAEF PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE STATES GROW YOUR OWN TEACHER RESIDENCY MODEL FOR TEACHER RAP OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARAPROFESSIONALS AND OTHERS INTERESTED IN THE TEACHING PROFESSION. THE K-12 TEACHER RAP PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY TO WORK WHILE MEETING QUALIFICATIONS FOR TEACHER LICENSURE.SUBRECIPIENT ROLES: OSD IS PLANNING TO WORK CLOSELY WITH THE NORTHEAST LOCAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AREA AND THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION TO SUPPORT GOALS 1 AND 2 AS OUTLINED IN THE RA EXPANSION WORK PLAN. LIST OF CREDENTIAL(S): IN THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR, INDUSTRY RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO RAPS BASED ON PARTICIPATING EMPLOYER NEEDS. FOR EDUCATIONAL SERVICES, TEACHER RAP IS A PATHWAY TO STATE TEACHER LICENSURE AS RECOGNIZED BY THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

STRENGTHEN AND DIVERSIFY THE STATEWIDE APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM THROUGH THE FULL IMPLEMENTATION OF REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PARTNERS INFORMATION DATABASE SYSTEM (RAPIDS) AND BY IMPROVING THE STATES OVERALL ALIGNMENT TO THE NATIONAL APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM.APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA WILL SUPPORT A FOCUSED STATEWIDE EXPANSION OF RAPS IN KEY INDUSTRIES BY DEVELOPING ONE NEW RAP FOR K-12 TEACHERS AND BY RECRUITING EMPLOYERS TO EXPAND THE STATEWIDE REACH OF ONE RAP INTERMEDIARY FOR EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION. SPECIFICALLY, THESE ACTIVITIES WILL IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR INNOVATION FOR RAP SPONSORS AND ENSURE GOOD JOBS FAIR LABOR STANDARDS FOR PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. TO HELP MEET THE GROWING DEMAND FOR SKILLED WORKERS IN THE CLEAN ECONOMY SECTOR, APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO EXISTING RAPS TO UPSKILL APPRENTICES AND INCUMBENT WORKERS IN NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND TO INCREASE OUTREACH TO EMPLOYERS WHO MANUFACTURE SEMICONDUCTORS TO ACCELERATE RAP ADOPTION. APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA AIMS TO SUPPORT RAP SPONSORS TO ADVANCE DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ACCESSIBILITY IN THEIR WORKFORCE BY CONDUCTING AN EQUITY AUDIT TO REVIEW INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL DEIA EFFORTS AND TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE MODEL THAT IS INCORPORATED INTO APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTAS FIVE-YEAR PLAN. ADDITIONALLY, RAPS WILL UPGRADE AND MOVE THEIR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLANS TO RAPIDS, AND APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA WILL ENGAGE WITH NEW PARTNERS THAT SERVE UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS. FINALLY, APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA WILL ENGAGE IN SEVERAL ACTIVITIES TO STRENGTHEN ALIGNMENT WITH THE NATIONAL APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM AND INCREASE DATA SHARING CAPACITY BY FULLY IMPLEMENTING THE RAPIDS AND BY INCORPORATING WIPS REPORTING. APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA WILL ALSO COMPLETE A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF STATE STATUTES, RULES, POLICIES, AND PROCEDURES. THROUGH THESE COORDINATED EFFORTS, APPRENTICESHIP MINNESOTA IS WELL POSITIONED TO BOTH MODERNIZE AND EXPAND THE APPRENTICESHIP SYSTEM AND TO REMOVE SYSTEMIC BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY THUS CONNECTING MORE MINNESOTANS TO FAMILY-SUSTAINING, LIVING WAGE CAREERS.SUBRECIPIENT ROLES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT.LIST OF CREDENTIALS TO BE AWARDED: JOURNEYWORKER CERTIFICATES FOR ALL OCCUPATIONS WILL BE AWARDED UPON PROGRAM COMPLETION. NDDPI WILL ANNUALLY USE  180,000 TO RUN A COMPETITIVE SOLICITATION PROCESS, WHERE UNIVERSITIES BID FOR GRANT FUNDS BASED ON THE QUALITY OF THEIR PROGRAM AND HOW MANY APPRENTICES THEY CAN SUPPORT. BASED ON THIS COMPETITIVE PROCESS, NDDPI PROJECTS DRAMATIC COST SAVINGS ON RELATED INSTRUCTION PROVIDER FEES. AT THE END OF YEAR 5, NDDPI AIMS FOR SAEF GRANT BASE FUNDS TO HAVE CREATED 3 NEW RAPS AND EXPANDED 7 RAPS, WITH 45  TOTAL APPRENTICES.THE REMAINING 40  OF FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS. WHILE NORTH DAKOTA REGISTERED ITS FIRST APPRENTICESHIP IN TEACHING MODEL IN DECEMBER 2022, IT CURRENTLY LACKS THE ADMINISTRATIVE INFRASTRUCTURE TO SCALE SUCH A MODEL STATEWIDE. THE BASE AWARD WOULD BE USED TO (1) PROVIDE SALARIES FOR PERSONNEL AT NDDPI WHO WOULD BE DEDICATED TO ADMINISTERING AND EXPANDING APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, (2) ALLOW STATEWIDE TRAVEL FOR NDDPI LEADERSHIP TO ENCOURAGE LOCAL BUY-IN AND COMPLIANCE TO THE APPRENTICESHIP MODEL, AND (3) SECURE CONTRACTOR SUPPORT TO ENSURE CLOSE COLLABORATION BETWEEN NDDPI AND NORTH DAKOTA UNIVERSITIES, WHO WILL SERVE AS RELATED INSTRUCTION PROVIDERS. AS NDDPI LOOKS TO SCALE APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS FOR THE FIRST TIME, SUCH ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES ARE CRITICAL TO ENSURING HIGH-QUALITY, LOW-COST PROGRAMS ARE ACCESSIBLE FOR ALL ASPIRING EDUCATORS.SUBRECIPIENT ROLESEDUCATION STANDARDS AND PRACTICES BOARD: SUBAWARD TO ESPB, WHO WILL CONTRACT WITH DR.
